results.firPara: A message from Michael Carrick, speaking to SkySports, with regard to the United crisis talk and the clamour for his inclusion The manager knows what I can do just like he knows what every player can do, Im not going to change the way I play now. You play some games, you dont play some games, thats how it goes ... I think everyone needs to calm down a bit.
results.secPara: United end their three-match losing streak and gain some respite before Saturdays clash with the Premier League champions. Mourinho might also have gained some clues about his lineup for that match, most obviously thanks to Michael Carrick, who ran midfield here with trademark zip, precision and intelligence. Herrera put forward a fair case for inclusion, too, as Uniteds had a better balance going forward. They still looked a little ropey at the back, however, and its unlikely that Blind will be put back into the startling lineup against the speedsters of Leicester. Rooney, since you ask, worked hard without looking sharp.
results.webTitle: Northampton Town v Manchester United: EFL Cup – as it happened

results.firPara: The Football Association has insisted Brexit will not derail its plans to hold the final stages of Euro 2020 at Wembley, hoping it will act as precursor to an England bid to host the 2028 European Championship.
results.secPara: Since the FA won the right to stage the 2020 semi-finals and final at Wembley as one of 12 venues for the tournament, which will be scattered across Europe under a plan drawn up by the former Uefa president Michel Platini, the UK has voted to leave the European Union.
results.webTitle: FA: Brexit will not derail plans to host final stages of Euro 2020 or 2028 bid

results.firPara: The new Uefa president, Aleksander Ceferin, has dismissed allegations that he used money loaned to the Slovenian FA for football development to invest in shares as a joke.
results.secPara: The ascent of Ceferin, a relative unknown outside his native Slovenia, to one of the biggest jobs in football has come under serious scrutiny in recent weeks.
results.webTitle: New Uefa president Aleksander Ceferin says loan allegations are a ‘joke’

results.firPara: • Midfielder was not informed personally that he was frozen out of squad
results.secPara: Yaya Touré did not know he had been frozen out by Pep Guardiola until the Manchester City manager revealed it publicly on Tuesday.
results.webTitle: Yaya Touré stung to learn of Pep Guardiola’s cold shoulder via media

results.firPara: How do you describe the Frenchman after two decades at Arsenal? A stubborn man? A loyal man? A romantic? A revolutionary? A relic? A survivor? The truth about this complex man is that he is all of them at the same time
results.secPara: When you look at Arsène Wenger what do you see? A shining light for longevity, the last of his kind overseeing a period of time at one club, something that is now unique? A 66-year-old manager who seems past it, his methods overtaken by younger, hungrier, craftier coaches? A stubborn man? A loyal man? A romantic? A revolutionary? A relic? A survivor?
results.webTitle: Arsène Wenger: 20 years at Arsenal – an incredible journey of joy and frustration | Amy Lawrence

results.firPara: To fully comprehend how much Englands top-flight has changed since Arsène Wenger first strode into Highburys famous marble halls for his official unveiling on 22 September 1996, a list of the other managers employed in the Premier League that day is most instructive.
results.secPara: Six years after the Czech Jozef Venglos became the first born outside Britain or Ireland to take charge of a top division club, Ruud Gullit – hired by Chelsea a few months previously to replace the new England manager Glenn Hoddle – was the only foreigner in a job, with the remainder all largely familiar faces steeped in the traditions of the old school.
results.webTitle: Twenty years of Wenger: where are the Arsenal manager’s rivals from 1996 now?

results.firPara: In todays Fiver Valencia, plus Emile Mpenza will he make it stand up in court?
results.secPara: In todays Fiver Valencia, plus Emile Mpenza will he make it stand up in court?

results.firPara: Yaya Touré is free to join any Premier League club in January, with Manchester City prepared to allow the midfielder to leave for a direct rival.
results.secPara: Touré has yet to decide if he wants to depart in the winter window despite Pep Guardiolas declaration that the Ivorian will not play for City again unless his agent, Dimitri Seluk, apologises for recent criticism. It is understood the club would countenance the Ivorian moving to another domestic team even if they were challenging City for the title.
results.webTitle: Yaya Touré free to leave Manchester City for any Premier League club

results.firPara: Cesc Fàbregas hopes his impressive goalscoring performance against Leicester City in the EFL Cup has proved to Antonio Conte that he deserves to start against Arsenal on Saturday, with the Spaniard claiming that his desire to get back into the Chelsea team is stronger than ever after a difficult start to the campaign.
results.secPara: The 29-year-old has played only 32 minutes of top-flight football this season, with Conte picking Oscar, Nemanja Matic and NGolo Kanté ahead of him in the Premier League. Fàbregas admitted that he has found that situation hard, but the former Barcelona midfielder insisted he would not concede defeat and said it was a measure of his determination to turn things around that he was training with the same enthusiasm he felt as a teenager at Arsenal.
results.webTitle: Cesc Fàbregas determined to prove his worth to Antonio Conte at Chelsea

results.firPara: The south-coast team with six England captain and the team that finished second six years in a row and more featured in our first live edition of the Knowledge
results.secPara: Theres only so much Knowledge a man can take in a single day, so were going to wrap up the blog now. Thanks for your questions and answers throughout, and if you need another fix, theres a 15-year Knowledge Archive that you can peruse here.
results.webTitle: The Knowledge: your football questions answered – as it happened!
